\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED \char`\"{}\+AS IS\char`\"{}, WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.

First implementation was derived from \mbox{\hyperlink{buffer_8h}{buffer.\+h}} We decided to change it to a stand alone version to keep the memory model as flat as possible, also for weak compilers.

\DoxyCodeLine{    \}\textcolor{keywordflow}{while} (0)}

\end{DoxyCode}
Pops the current head item in the ringbuffer, or in other words\+: increases the head index to address the next item in the ringbuffer. Automatically wraps around the head index in case of index overflow. Also decreases the number of items in the ringbuffer by one. 

Definition at line 175 of file ringbuffer.\+h.

\DoxyCodeLine{    \}\textcolor{keywordflow}{while} (0)}

\end{DoxyCode}
Pushes the current tail item in the ringbuffer, or in other words\+: increases the tail index to address the next item in the ringbuffer. Automatically wraps around the tail index in case of index overflow. Also increases the number of items in the ringbuffer by one. 

Definition at line 158 of file ringbuffer.\+h.

{\bfseries Value\+:}
\begin{DoxyCode}{0}

\DoxyCodeLine{        var = \mbox{\hyperlink{ringbuffer_8h_add57f7fa1a594bf8c8345cb7ad1cdf1e}{RINGBUFFER\_HEAD\_VAL}}(ringbufferptr);   \(\backslash\)}

\DoxyCodeLine{    \}\textcolor{keywordflow}{while}(0)}

\end{DoxyCode}
Reads one item into /a var by value. Automatically pops the ringbuffer. Read oldest element. App must ensure !\+RINGBUFFER\+\_\+\+EMPTY() first.

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{RINGBUFFER\_TYPEDEF}{RINGBUFFER\_TYPEDEF}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define RINGBUFFER\+\_\+\+TYPEDEF(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{name,  }\item[{}]{type,  }\item[{}]{size }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

{\bfseries Value\+:}
\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{    \textcolor{keyword}{typedef} \textcolor{keyword}{struct }\{                        \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{        size\_t head;                        \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{        size\_t tail;                        \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{        size\_t count;                       \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{        type items [size];                  \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{    \} name\#\#\_ringbuffer\_t}

\end{DoxyCode}
Declares a ringbuffer type. The argumnents are {\itshape name} for a unique identification of the ringbuffer type, the {\itshape type} of the items and the number of items of {\itshape type} the ringbuffer can hold ({\itshape size}).

\index{ringbuffer.h@{ringbuffer.h}!RINGBUFFER\_WRITE@{RINGBUFFER\_WRITE}}
\index{RINGBUFFER\_WRITE@{RINGBUFFER\_WRITE}!ringbuffer.h@{ringbuffer.h}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{RINGBUFFER\_WRITE}{RINGBUFFER\_WRITE}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define RINGBUFFER\+\_\+\+WRITE(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{ringbufferptr,  }\item[{}]{value }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

{\bfseries Value\+:}
\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{    \textcolor{keywordflow}{do} \{                                                \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{        RINGBUFFER\_TAIL\_VAL(ringbufferptr) = value;     \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{        RINGBUFFER\_PUSH(ringbufferptr);                 \(\backslash\)}
\DoxyCodeLine{    \}\textcolor{keywordflow}{while}(0)}

\end{DoxyCode}
Writes one item into ringbuffer by value. Automatically pushes the ringbuffer. Overwrites the oldest element if ringbuffer is full. App can choose to avoid the overwrite by checking \mbox{\hyperlink{ringbuffer_8h_a3b1379ffc509d6d79b752add90e082e2}{RINGBUFFER\+\_\+\+FULL()}}. 

Definition at line 218 of file ringbuffer.\+h.
